Collector 0.6.2 documentation

Crawl

«  Collector   ::   Contents

Crawl¶

Schema¶

class collector.crawl.Schema(name, page, urls=None)¶

The whole set of rules to be collected across one or more pages of a website

Parameters:
  • name (string) – name of the Schema
  • page (Page) – the default page for the Schema
  • urls (list) – list of initial urls to collect data from
crawl_urls()¶

iterate over the urls in self.urls, then merge the resulting data based on the sets in the default page of the schema

get(url)¶

takes a url and iterates over pages, starting with the default page

Parameters:url (string) – url to collect data from

Page¶

class collector.crawl.Page(name, sets, next=None, dynamic=False)¶

A Page is analogous to a webpage on a website. Given a url, the Page fetches the DOM for that url and the Page uses its SelectorSets to collect data

Parameters:
  • name (string) – name of the page
  • sets (list) – the selector sets associated with the page
  • next (string) – is a selector for another index page (optional)
  • dynamic (boolean) – whether or not data necessary to collect is dynamically loaded (so need to use selenium/phantomjs)
get(url)¶

iterate over sets, returning a dict holding the captured values and a dict mapping page names to “follow” urls

next_page(url)¶

given a dom and Page.next not being None, apply the next selector to the dom and return the href attribute for the match

class collector.crawl.SelectorSet(name, selectors, pages=None, parent=None)¶

A SelectorSet consists of a group of (related?) selector/rule pairs in a page

Parameters:
  • name (string) – name of the selector set
  • selectors (list) – selectors that correspond to the selector set
  • pages (list) – pages whose data cannot be crawled until a rule (with follow=True) in one of the selectors has been captured
  • parent (Parent) – (optional) parent selector and range (high/low) to limit matches for the selectors
apply(dom)¶

given a dom, iterate over selector returning dict of {rule name:value} pairs and a dict of {page name: url} pairs to crawl subsequent pages

get(dom)¶

returns an object where the key is a rule’s name and the value is if self.parent, return a list otherwise, return a dict

class collector.crawl.Parent(selector, low=None, high=None)¶

A Parent is used to limit selectors to a subset of the page. A Parent is especially useful if there are multiple sets of selectors/rules in a page that should be captured. For example, given a table where you want to capture data from multiple columns for each row, a Parent selector that selects the rows could then be used to capture the column data across the row and return a list of the captured data for each row in the table.

Given the following html:

<table>
    <th>
        <td>Name</td>
        <td>Age</td>
    </th>
    <tr>
        <td class="name">Bill</td>
        <td class="age">32</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <td class="name">Dave</td>
        <td class="age">51</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <td class="name">Sue</td>
        <td class="age">28</td>
    </tr>
</table>

A Parent selector of “tr” would allow you to use the selectors ”.name” and ”.age” to collect the name and age for each row individually, giving you the data:

[
    {"name": "Bill", "age": 32},
    {"name": "Dave", "age": 51},
    {"name": "Sue", "age": 28}
]
Parameters:
  • selector (string) – the selector to break up the dom into multiple elements
  • low (int) – is the number of elements to skip from the beginning
  • high (int) – is the number of elements to skip from the end

Rule¶

class collector.crawl.Selector(selector, rules, multiple=False)¶

A selector is used to select element(s) from a dom to apply rules to

Parameters:
  • selector (string) – CSS selector to select element(s) in the DOM that Rule data should be captured from
  • rules (list) – list of Rules that are applied to elements matching the selector
  • multiple (boolean) – whether or not the selector should only match the first element or all elements that match the selector
class collector.crawl.Rule(name, capture, follow=False)¶

A rule corresponds to a column in a sql tuple

Parameters:
  • name (string) – the name of the column
  • capture (string) – is the attribute of the item(s) that you want to store eg. attr-href means that you want to get the element’s href attribute text means that you want the text content of the element
get(ele)¶

given an element, return the desired attribute for the element

set_capture()¶

returns a function that captures the desired attribute or the text based on the self.capture value
